definitions: native or inhabitant of the Kashmir region in South Asia
Indo-Aryan language spoken primarily in the Kashmir Valley
examples: The Kashmiri artisan created beautiful pashmina shawls
Many Kashmiris emigrated during the political conflicts
She studied Kashmiri to understand her grandmother's poetry
The document was translated from Kashmiri into English

definitions: thick flat piece of stone, concrete, or other material
thick slice or portion of something, especially food
examples: The concrete slab formed the foundation of the building
Workers lifted the marble slab onto the kitchen counter
He ordered a thick slab of chocolate cake
The butcher cut generous slabs of bacon

definitions: looseness or lack of tension in a rope or line
period of reduced activity or low demand in business
loose-fitting casual trousers, typically worn for informal occasions
examples: Pull the rope tight to remove any slack
The cable had too much slack and sagged
Business experiences slack during the winter months
They hired temporary workers during the slack season
He wore slack and a polo shirt to the meeting
The dress code allows slack but not jeans

definitions: person who avoids work or effort, especially habitually
examples: The manager warned the slacker about his poor performance
Don't be a slacker; finish your assignments on time
The team couldn't tolerate slackers who didn't contribute
He transformed from a slacker into a dedicated employee

definitions: skiing race down a zigzag course marked by poles or gates
examples: She won the gold medal in the giant slalom event
The slalom course challenged even experienced skiers
He practiced slalom techniques on the steep mountain slope
Slalom requires quick turns and precise control

definitions: loud bang caused by forcefully closing something
harsh verbal attack or severe criticism
winning of all tricks in bridge or similar card games
examples: The door slam woke everyone in the house
The slam of the window rattled the walls
The movie received a slam from every critic
His public slam of the policy caused controversy
She bid for a grand slam in the bridge tournament
Making a slam requires skill and favorable cards

definitions: making of false spoken statements damaging to a person's reputation
examples: The politician sued the reporter for slander
Spreading slander about colleagues is unprofessional
The court ruled that his comments constituted slander
She defended herself against accusations of slander

definitions: very informal language consisting of words and expressions not considered standard
examples: Teenagers often use slang their parents don't understand
The dictionary included common slang expressions
Internet slang evolves rapidly with new terms
He avoided using slang in formal presentations

definitions: slope or lean in a particular direction at an angle
particular point of view or bias in presenting information
examples: The roof had a steep slant to shed rain
The slant of the hillside made climbing difficult
The article had a political slant favoring conservatives
Each newspaper puts its own slant on the story

definitions: blow with the palm of the hand or flat object
action or comment that insults or rebuffs someone
examples: The slap left a red mark on his cheek
She gave the mosquito a quick slap
The rejection was a slap to his pride
The new policy was a slap in the face to workers

definitions: comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions and exaggerated physical humor
examples: The movie featured classic slapstick with pie throwing
Charlie Chaplin was a master of slapstick comedy
The play's slapstick humor appealed to children
Modern comedians rarely use traditional slapstick

definitions: long cut or wound made with a sweeping stroke
diagonal punctuation mark (/) used to separate alternatives
dramatic reduction in price or quantity
examples: The knife left a deep slash across the canvas
The slash on his arm required several stitches
Use a slash between alternative words like and/or
The date was written with slashes: 12/25/2024
The store announced a massive slash in prices
Budget slashes affected many government programs

definitions: person or tool that cuts or slashes violently
horror film featuring graphic violence and a killer
examples: The jungle slasher cleared paths with his machete
The vandal was described as a tire slasher
The slasher movie scared audiences nationwide
Classic slashers often feature masked killers

definitions: thin narrow piece of wood, plastic, or metal
examples: The blind's slats filtered the morning sunlight
He replaced the broken slat in the fence
The bed frame needed new slats for support
Venetian blinds have adjustable horizontal slats

definitions: fine-grained gray rock that splits into flat smooth plates
small tablet of slate for writing on with chalk
list of candidates for election or appointment
examples: The roof was covered with Welsh slate tiles
Slate quarries provided building material for centuries
Students wrote on slates before paper became common
The teacher wrote equations on her slate
The party announced its slate of candidates
Voters approved the entire slate of proposals

definitions: killing of animals for food in a systematic way
brutal killing of large numbers of people or animals
examples: The slaughter of cattle requires strict hygiene standards
Annual turkey slaughter increases before Thanksgiving
The battle resulted in terrible slaughter on both sides
Wildlife advocates protested the slaughter of seals

definitions: building where animals are killed and processed for meat commercially
examples: The slaughterhouse processed thousands of chickens daily
Health inspectors regularly checked the local slaughterhouse
Workers at the slaughterhouse followed strict safety protocols
The old slaughterhouse was converted into apartments

definitions: person who is legal property of another and forced to work
device controlled by another device in a computer system
examples: Slaves built many historical monuments under harsh conditions
The abolitionists fought to free all slaves
The slave drive mirrors data from the master drive
Configure the printer as a slave device

definitions: person who legally owns slaves as property
examples: Many slaveholders owned large plantations in the South
The slaveholder's wealth depended on unpaid labor
Historical records document slaveholder family names
Abolitionists confronted slaveholders about moral issues

definitions: ship used for transporting slaves in the slave trade
saliva drooling from the mouth uncontrollably
examples: The slaver carried hundreds of captives across the Atlantic
Archaeologists discovered remains of an old slaver
The dog's slaver dripped onto the floor
Medical conditions can cause excessive slaver

definitions: system in which people are treated as property and forced to work without pay
examples: Slavery was abolished in the United States in 1865
Modern slavery still exists in various forms worldwide
The museum exhibit documented the horrors of slavery
Economic slavery traps people in debt bondage

definitions: person who kills another person or creature violently
examples: The dragon slayer became a legendary hero
Police searched for the slayer of three victims
In mythology, the slayer often faces monsters
The vampire slayer protected the town from evil

definitions: act of killing someone or something in a violent manner
examples: The slaying shocked the quiet neighborhood community
Medieval tales often featured the slaying of beasts
Police investigated the brutal slaying downtown
The slaying of the tyrant ended his reign

definitions: quality of being sordid, corrupt, or morally degraded
examples: The scandal exposed sleaze in city government
Tabloids thrive on celebrity sleaze and gossip
Political sleaze undermined public trust in officials
The bar had an atmosphere of cheap sleaze

definitions: vehicle on runners for traveling over snow or ice
examples: Children rode their sleds down the snowy hill
The sled dogs pulled supplies across Alaska
She bought a new sled for winter recreation
The wooden sled had metal runners underneath

definitions: activity of riding on a sled over snow or ice
examples: Sledding remains popular winter entertainment for families
The sledding conditions were perfect after the snowfall
They went sledding at the local park
Sledding accidents can cause serious injuries

definitions: heavy sled used for transporting loads over snow or ice
large heavy hammer used for breaking rocks or driving stakes
examples: The expedition used sledges to carry equipment
Arctic explorers pulled sledges across frozen terrain
Workers used a sledge to break the concrete
The sledge drove fence posts into hard ground

definitions: large heavy hammer with a long handle used for heavy work
examples: The demolition crew used sledgehammers to break walls
He swung the sledgehammer to drive in stakes
A sledgehammer can deliver tremendous striking force
The worker's sledgehammer weighed twenty pounds

definitions: natural periodic state of rest for mind and body with closed eyes
examples: Eight hours of sleep improves mental performance
The baby's sleep was disturbed by noise
Deep sleep occurs in regular cycles throughout night
Lack of sleep affects concentration and mood

definitions: person who is asleep or who sleeps in specified way
wooden or concrete beam supporting railroad tracks
person or thing that achieves unexpected success after period of obscurity
examples: Light sleepers wake easily from small noises
The sleeper stirred but didn't wake up
Railroad sleepers need regular replacement and maintenance
Wooden sleepers have been replaced with concrete
The movie became a sleeper hit at box offices
The sleeper candidate won the election surprisingly

definitions: state or action of being in natural rest with closed eyes
examples: Sleeping peacefully requires a comfortable environment
The sleeping child looked angelic in bed
Sleeping patterns change with age and lifestyle
Avoid eating before sleeping for better rest

definitions: person who walks or performs activities while asleep
examples: The sleepwalker wandered downstairs without waking up
Parents worried about their child being a sleepwalker
Sleepwalkers often have no memory of their actions
The doctor treated several sleepwalkers for safety concerns

definitions: walking or performing complex behaviors while in deep sleep
examples: Sleepwalking occurs during deep non-REM sleep stages
His sleepwalking episodes happened during stressful periods
Sleepwalking can be dangerous without safety precautions
Children often outgrow sleepwalking by adolescence

definitions: rain that freezes into ice pellets before reaching the ground
examples: Driving becomes hazardous when sleet covers roads
The sleet pelted against the windows loudly
Weather forecasters predicted sleet and freezing rain
Sleet accumulated on power lines causing outages

definitions: part of garment that covers all or part of arm
protective cover or casing for records, documents, or equipment
examples: She rolled up her sleeves before washing dishes
The jacket had long sleeves with buttoned cuffs
Store the vinyl record in its protective sleeve
The document sleeve kept papers clean and organized

definitions: sled drawn by horses or reindeer, especially for passengers
examples: The sleigh glided smoothly through the snowy forest
Santa's sleigh is pulled by flying reindeer
They took a romantic sleigh ride through the park
The antique sleigh had ornate decorations and bells

definitions: use of dexterity or cunning to deceive or trick
examples: The magician's sleight of hand amazed the audience

The con artist's sleight fooled many victims

definitions: person who investigates crimes or searches for information like detective
examples: The amateur sleuth solved the neighborhood mystery

The sleuth followed clues to find answers

definitions: large number or quantity of something
examples: A slew of complaints flooded the customer service
The festival featured a slew of performers

definitions: thin broad piece cut from something larger
share or portion of something divided among people
examples: She cut a thin slice of bread for toast
The pizza slice was loaded with toppings

The company captured a slice of market share

definitions: action of cutting something into thin pieces
examples: Slicing vegetables requires a sharp knife
The slicing machine cut meat uniformly

The slicing technique affected food presentation

definitions: patch of oil or similar substance on water surface
smooth slippery surface or area
examples: The oil slick threatened marine wildlife habitats
Cleanup crews worked to contain the slick

Ice slicks formed on the sidewalk overnight

definitions: smooth sloping surface for sliding down as playground equipment
small piece of photographic film in frame for projection
act of moving smoothly along a surface
examples: Children lined up to go down the slide
The playground had a tall spiral slide

The mud slide blocked the mountain road
Stock prices continued their slide downward

definitions: small hamburger typically served as appetizer or snack
baseball pitch that curves laterally as it approaches
movable control in user interface for adjusting values
examples: The restaurant served delicious beef sliders
Party guests enjoyed the variety of sliders
The pitcher's slider fooled the batter completely
He perfected his slider during spring training
Adjust the volume using the slider control
The brightness slider ranges from zero to one hundred

definitions: insult caused by failure to show proper respect or attention
examples: She felt the slight when not invited to dinner

definitions: thick slippery liquid substance, typically regarded as repulsive
examples: Green slime covered the pond's surface completely

Children love playing with colorful slime toys
Algae slime made the rocks dangerously slippery

definitions: bandage or soft strap supporting injured arm
weapon for throwing stones using cord and pouch
examples: His broken arm rested in a sling

Ancient warriors used slings in battle

definitions: person who uses a sling as weapon or tool
examples: Ancient slingers were valued military units

definitions: Y-shaped stick with elastic band for shooting small projectiles
examples: The boy made a slingshot from a forked branch
Using a slingshot requires practice and aim
Dennis the Menace carried his trusty slingshot
The slingshot propelled pebbles across the yard

definitions: minor or careless mistake in speech or action
small piece of paper with information written on it
woman's undergarment worn beneath a dress or skirt
examples: A slip of the tongue revealed his secret
The accounting slip cost the company thousands
She wrote her number on a slip of paper
The permission slip required parental signature
Her silk slip showed beneath the sheer dress
The slip provided an extra layer of coverage
